description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ehrnc","text":"The current procedure is for quantitative determination of aflatoxin M1 (AFM1) and B1(AFB1) in animal liver by HPLC-fluorescence detection at concentrations 0.2-10 ng/g (ppb). Note, sensitivity of the method greatly depends on sensitivity of the fluorescent detector. The method requires 1g of liver. Quantitation is based on matrix-matched calibration curve. Analytes (AfB1 and AfM1) are extracted, derivatized, cleaned up using Octadecyl (C18) material, injected into HPLC and chromatographed on C18 column for fluorescence detection.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":70,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":76,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":84,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":89,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"50dun","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4jtbl","text":"Validation data (in-house and via collaborative studies such as Blinded Method Tests) are available in the following publications:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9st1u","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a7b3n","text":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/27638844/","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":41}],"data":{}},{"key":"f6n8f","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4sgc6","text":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/30736868/","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":41}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"73424112274511EE86FC0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/27638844"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A7E053B9274511EE86FC0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/30736868"}}}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"2eerd","text":"Reference to any commercial materials, equipment, or process does not in any way constitute approval, endorsement, or recommendation by the Food and Drug Administration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"7vb2n","text":"Each lab should perform a practice run to check the optimal incubation time and HPLC run time at three levels (low at 0.8 ppb, medium at 5 ppb, and high at 8 ppb). After incubation, inject samples at 20 h, 24 h, 28 h, and 32 h to check signal drift for each aflatoxin. The optimal incubation time is the time when minimal signal drift is observed.A signal drift of ± 15% is acceptable.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b8ah8","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fdh2a","text":"The HPLC run time is optimal as long as the last eluting peak has returned to the baseline (2-4 minutes) before the run has ended.The validated run time is 25 minutes, if needed the run time can be extended in 5-10 minutes increments until the run time has been optimized.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Aflatoxins B1,aflatoxin M1,aflatoxin B2,aflatoxin G1,aflatoxin G2
manuscript_citation: {"blocks":[{"key":"1molv","text":"1. Intralaboratory development and evaluation of a high-performance liquid chromatography–fluorescence method for detection and quantitation of aflatoxins M1, B1, B2, G1, and G2 in animal liver. Dahai Shao, Paula M. Imerman, Dwayne E. Schrunk, Steve M. Ensley, Wilson K. Rumbeiha. Journal of Veterinary Diagnostic Investigation 2016, Vol. 28(6) 646– 655 https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/27638844/","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":354,"length":41}],"data":{}},{"key":"74aj9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"n2l6","text":"2. Evaluation of a Diagnostic Method to Quantify Aflatoxins B1 and M1 in Animal Liver by High-Performance Liquid Chromatography with Fluorescence Detection.  Xiangwei Du, Dwayne E Schrunk, Paula M Imerman, Lori Smith, Kyle Francis, John Tahara, Andriy Tkachenko, Renate Reimschuessel, Wilson K Rumbeiha. J AOAC Int. 2019 Sep 1;102(5):1530-1534. doi: 10.5740/jaoacint.18-0355.Epub 2019 Feb 8.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":158,"length":11},{"key":2,"offset":171,"length":16},{"key":3,"offset":189,"length":15},{"key":4,"offset":206,"length":10},{"key":5,"offset":218,"length":12},{"key":6,"offset":232,"length":11},{"key":7,"offset":245,"length":16},{"key":8,"offset":263,"length":20},{"key":9,"offset":285,"length":17}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"8FDAA782274511EE86FC0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/27638844"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B257DA7C0AF911EEACE10A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=Du+X\u0026cauthor_id=30736868"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B257D9440AF911EEACE10A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=Schrunk+DE\u0026cauthor_id=30736868"}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B257DA070AF911EEACE10A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=Imerman+PM\u0026cauthor_id=30736868"}},"4":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B257D8250AF911EEACE10A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=Smith+L\u0026cauthor_id=30736868"}},"5":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B257D7DB0AF911EEACE10A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=Francis+K\u0026cauthor_id=30736868"}},"6":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B257DAB80AF911EEACE10A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=Tahara+J\u0026cauthor_id=30736868"}},"7":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B257DAF10AF911EEACE10A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=Tkachenko+A\u0026cauthor_id=30736868"}},"8":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B257D7560AF911EEACE10A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=Reimschuessel+R\u0026cauthor_id=30736868"}},"9":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE"," Part #: 10328170","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":7,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"35knd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9la6q","text":"Glass mL borosilicate glass scintillation vials, Fisher Scientific (Waltham, MA, USA), Cat. #: 03-337-26.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9rmbn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fcpjo","text":"Syringes, 6 mL, Monoject, Kendall, Part #: 1180600555.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"94l1l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9p16m","text":" 55 mL screw cap glass tubes, Fisher Scientific (Waltham, MA, USA), Cat. #: 14-933D or 50 mL screw cap glass tubes, Fisher Scientific (Waltham, MA, USA), Cat. #: 05-558-5B.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":84,"length":30},{"style":"italic","offset":84,"length":30},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":84,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":30},{"key":2,"offset":30,"length":43},{"key":3,"offset":76,"length":7}],"data":{}},{"key":"1kgj4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4fo6p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4r273","text":"EQUIPMENT","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4fkl0","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eh95p","text":"Centrifuges. Bench top centrifuge (IEC Centra-GP8 or equivalent).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ckrj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"40uid","text":"Balances. Capable of weighing minimum: 0.01 g (Mettler Toledo or equivalent).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bf4co","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cl6se","text":"Mixers and shakers. Single tube vortex mixer (VWR or equivalent), Rotor rack shaker (LabQuake, Thermo Scientific or equivalent).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3qe2i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3c5oh","text":"Pipettes. Variable pipettes to cover ranges of 1.00-10.00 µL, 10.0-100.0 µL, 100-1000 µL, and 1-10 mL. (Eppendorf or equivalent).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"j7fh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"28cc7","text":"Heating bath. Digital dry bath (GeneMate or equivalent).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6q05s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6qp9a","text":"A Waters high performance liquid chromatography equipped with a Waters 2695 separation module including a vacuum degasser, a quaternary pump, an automatic sample injection system, a Waters 2475 Multi-wavelength fluorescence detector, and the Empower software to control the instrument, data acquisition, and data analysis is used for separation and quantification of aflatoxins (or equivalent).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1idkq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"704q0","text":"HPLC column. C18 reverse phase column (Brownlee C18, 5 µm, 80 Å, 100mm × 4.6 mm, I.D. Perkin Elmer, Waltham, MA, USA, part #: 0711-0015). A guard column (Agilent Pursuit XRs C18, MetaGuard, 3µmm, 2.0 mm, part #: A6001MG2) is used.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1e0v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6gktj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"29res","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"ABE492AE712911EDACFB0A58A9FEAC02","url":null}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"ABE492F8712911EDACFB0A58A9FEAC02","url":null}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"ABE4932C712911EDACFB0A58A9FEAC02","url":null}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"ABE49365712911EDACFB0A58A9FEAC02","url":null}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"82gk1","text":"The standard stock solutions of each aflatoxin is prepared by dissolving the pre-weighed standards in chloroform (AFM1) or methanol (AFB1) and stored in   when not in use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":153,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5a56v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"B7848850759011EDB77ABDD6A3631F4E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3u4i9","text":"A mixed standard solution (250 ng/mL for each aflatoxin) is prepared. Quantitatively transfer   of the AFM1 stock standard and  of the AFB1 stock standard to a  scintillation glass vial.            ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":94,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":127,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":159,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"827er","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bpsqe","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8lcru","text":"                                           ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"439C0FD0C80B11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"459C4CA0C80B11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"7","error":false,"guid":"46CF9C80C80B11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1n5j4","text":"Concentrate to dryness by nitrogen effusion and dilute in 4 mL methanol. It is stored at -20°C when not in use and is good for one year.      ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a164j","text":"A working standard solution (25 ng/mL) is prepared by dilution of the 250 ng/mL standard solution using methanol. It is prepared on the day of use. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6bavr","text":"Transfer  of the 250 ng/mL mixed standard to a 7 mL vial, add  of methanol and vortex to mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":62,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f6hfo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"evoe7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9iau","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.5","error":false,"guid":"94984BF0759111ED9EB2272DD79D022A","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"4.5","error":false,"guid":"513E5B70C80B11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"j3t","text":"20% Citric acid solution is prepared by weighing   of citric acid monohydrate and dissolving in de-ionized water to give a final volume of . This amount is good for about 80-90 samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":49,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":138,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f6vi2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20.0","error":false,"guid":"93724B50C80B11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"96428250C80B11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1j7q","text":"Acetonitrile/water 90/10 (v/v) is prepared by adding  de-ionized water to  acetonitrile and mixed well. This amount is good for 80-90 samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":53,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":74,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b470t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"69764EF0C80B11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"900","error":false,"guid":"6D8B3AF0C80B11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"at9g8","text":"Octadecyl (C18) LC packing / alumina neutral 50/50 (w/w) is prepared by mixing  alumina neutral and  Octadecyl (C18) LC packing in a sealable plastic container. The mixture is shaken for five minutes. Shake for five seconds before each use. This amount is good for about 80-90 samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":79,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":100,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3p3r0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"70.0","error":false,"guid":"7F3B1F90C80B11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"70.0","error":false,"guid":"83AFDED0C80B11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"77im6","text":"Clean-up columns are prepared by weighing   premixed 50/50 (w/w) Octadecyl (C18) 40 µm Preparation LC packing/Alumina Neutral into 6 mL plastic syringes. The C18/alumina mixture is immobilized by 2 Whatman 740-E filter discs on both ends.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":42,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d71q8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eqrrv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2q6pr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1.50","error":false,"guid":"18F92FA0C80C11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"36cdb","text":"Filter discs are placed with the larger side facing up, and assure that the filter discs and the packing material are firmly seated in the syringe.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3utis","text":"Preparation of calibration curve in liver matrix: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":49}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6b9b1","text":"Seven  control liver samples are weighed in 50 mL screw cap glass tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":6,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7g1n8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1.0","error":false,"guid":"86230C40C80C11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":" +/- 0.02 g","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"22m3i","text":"A series of volumes (8.0 μL, 20.0 μL, 40.0 μL, 80.0 μL, 200 μL, and 400 μL) of the 25 ng/mL working standard solution of aflatoxin M1 and B1 is spiked to 1.0 g of control liver to give a series of fortified concentration of 0.2, 0.5, 1.0, 2.0, 5.0, 10.0 ng/g. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":132,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":139,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f7hhg","text":"The fortified samples are mixed thoroughly by vortexing for   at maximum speed and subject to the following steps 7.2-7.4. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":60,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7m60r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":10,"guid":"917BB600C80C11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4c9pb","text":"Extraction","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3k0d","text":"  of liver samples are weighed in 50 mL screw cap glass tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":1,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4c3kb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1.0","error":false,"guid":"A6246840C80C11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"+/- 0.02 g","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9k3b3","text":"1.0 mL of 20% citric acid solution is added to each sample and calibrant.   Samples and calibrants are subsequently mixed thoroughly by vortexing for approximately   at maximum speed. Samples are allowed to sit for 5-10 minutes and mixed again. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":164,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1dorf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":10,"guid":"AB74E180C80C11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8offf","text":"  CeliteTM is added to each sample and followed by vortexing for at maximum speed.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":8,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":64,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1fhaj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"elr2c","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1pcor","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.20","error":false,"guid":"BFFFAB80C80C11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":10,"guid":"C379DE20C80C11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5vdet","text":"If the initial mass of liver is not 1.0 g, then the amount of Celite is adjusted accordingly based on the ratio 1.0:0.2 (liver mass: Celite, w/w). ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f9v6a","text":"  of dichloromethane is then added to each sample and calibrant.   Vortex for  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":78,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cphi4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20.0","error":false,"guid":"D53CFCA0C80C11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":10,"guid":"D77A1B60C80C11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c88ls","text":"The mixture is mounted on Roto rack for rotate-mixing for  , followed by centrifuge at 2000 rpm for  . ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":58,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":100,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"efvht","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":2100,"guid":"E06806B0C80C11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"E4F0C320C80C11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4uhtv","text":"After centrifugation, the bottom clear layer is carefully aspirated and passed through sodium sulfate (7.20 g) housed in a set of glass fiber filter circle and plastic funnel. The filtrates are collected in clean 50 mL tubes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"94hnp","text":"Sodium sulfate is then washed with   dichloromethane. The wash is combined with the solution obtained from step 10.6","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":35,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6c7cg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"6","error":false,"guid":"F4602DA0C80C11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2iq47","text":"The solutions are subsequently concentrated to dryness by gentle nitrogen effusion at ambient temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b8d0q","text":"Clean-up ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aj0hc","text":"The dried extracts obtained in the previous step are reconstituted in  90/10 (v/v) acetonitrile/water and vortexed for  at maximum speed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":69,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":119,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2o01f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5.0","error":false,"guid":"FE9EB4D0C80C11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":10,"guid":"02A08E00C80D11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d7kqg","text":"Clean-up columns are pre-conditioned by   90/10 (v/v) acetonitrile/water before use. The acetonitrile/water is discarded.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":85,"length":36},{"style":"italic","offset":85,"length":36},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":85,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":40,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"375he","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5.0","error":false,"guid":"087D8FD0C80D11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fi79u","text":"The dissolved extracts are then loaded on clean-up columns. The solution flowing through the columns is collected in a new 7.0 mL scintillation vial. Solutions are allowed to flow through by gravity. After all the solution flows through the column, the plungers are pushed down to the barrel of the syringe to drive out the residual liquid in the packing. The residual liquid is received in the same 7.0 mL vials for each sample. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":119,"length":3},{"style":"italic","offset":119,"length":3},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":119,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bk3pi","text":"The solutions are subsequently concentrated to dryness by gentle nitrogen effusion at ambient temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7itgn","text":"Derivatization","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dv13m","text":"The residue obtained in the previous step are reconstituted in   35/10/5 (v/v) water/TFA/glacial acetic acid, vortexed for   at maximum speed, then heated at 65°C in heating dry bath for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":63,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":123,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":187,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c9jhc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"400","error":false,"guid":"10EFBB70C80D11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":10,"guid":"16235DE0C80D11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"27014C80C80D11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3no21","text":"The solutions obtained from this step are incubated at ambient temperature for 16-20 hours (This incubation time needs to be optimized under each lab’s conditions, see Guidelines) before HPLC analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":91,"length":89},{"style":"italic","offset":91,"length":89},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":91,"length":89}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9kk5t","text":"The optimized excitation and emission wavelengths for the fluorescence detector are 360 and 440 nm, respectively.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4rspd","text":"The mobile phase consisting of water (A) and acetonitrile (B) is pumped at a flow rate of 1.0 mL/min. A gradient elution is used to give the optimized separation. The details of the gradient program is as follows: 0-7.5 min isocratic step at 86% A, 14% B; 0.5 min linear gradient (7.5-8.0 min) to 85% A, 15% B, an isocratic step from 8.0 to 20.0 min at 85% A, 15% B; a 1.0 min linear gradient (20.0-21.0 min) to 86% A, 14% B; and a final isocratic step at 86% A, 14% B to the end. A total running time is 25 min. (This needs to be optimized according to each lab’s HPLC system, see Guidelines).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":513,"length":81},{"style":"italic","offset":513,"length":81},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":513,"length":81}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6jj34","text":"An injection volume of  is used. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":23,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9vtns","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"737C9D30C80D11EDA1A97F9D66053B56","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8qqku","text":"Retention time: based on the above-mentioned HPLC conditions, aflatoxin M1 chromatographs at approximately 4.0 minutes, aflatoxin B1 chromatographs at approximately 18.2 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":73,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":131,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9h38s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8s095","text":"The calibration curve is created by plotting the blank-subtracted fluorescence intensity (the peak are of fluorescence unit) versus the injected mass of standard (in ng) by linear regression.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Procedure for Aflatoxin M1 and B1 in Liver by HPLC-Fluorescence Detection with Pre-column Derivatization

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"f6nci","text":"- Wear gloves, lab coat and protective eye wear. Conduct all steps involving organic compounds in fume hoods. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"47t44","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9o9ha","text":"- Aflatoxin M1 and B1 are toxic and carcinogenic and hence should be handled with extreme care.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":13,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":20,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":13,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F69C7900712911EDACFB0A58A9FEAC02","url":null}}}}
